author: touchhimwiththejab
body:
Who was this autist 

Specifically, Chen used his employee security badge to gain unauthorized access to the company’s restricted office area for the accounting and financial staff. Once inside, Chen went through the desks and work areas to find the company’s non-public earnings reports. Using this confidential information, Chen bought large amounts of Skyworks securities. Once Skyworks released its earnings reports to the public, Chen sold his Skyworks securities for a profit.

author: RaptorMan333
body:
ADBE, AMD, DBX, SQ, PYPL, SE, AAPL, MSFT, ARKK, ARKF, JMIA, BB, FB, CLOU, SWKS, SMH

Just pick whatever looks interesting to you, put maybe $1-2k in right now spread across all of them, and then slowly add more on red days to whichever is down. Personally, i would keep like $5k on the side in case of a correction in the next few months.

author: Vonserb
body: We could see growth start to appear once they sell DirectTV which was a dumb move for them to buy in the first place,  but the big one is 5G.  They’re really pushing their unlimited packages which are expensive data plans with new 5G phones.  I think they’ll benefit like, VZ, Apple, Skyworks from this super cycle in cellular.

author: THE_RED_BARON777
body:
Your comment includes most sectors in the EV space. You forgot to mention they already have a product they are selling. On semiconductor ( not a spac) is doing fairly well as a competitor. I'm notan engineer but a previous comment on another thread spoke on how it separates itself through their communication systems. This market will be huge and there will be enough of the pie to go around in the same way battery companies will also benefit from market growth. They have a solid SPAC team and leadership

"Upon the closing of the transaction, the combined company will be led by indie’s management team. Prior to founding indie, Donald McClymont held executive roles at Axiom, Skyworks and Conexant. " Axiom was a top semiconductor company bought by skyworks. I believe this company has enough ties in the market that there is a potential to get bought out. However you're right.. just like every other SPAC they will need to reach their lofty evaluations.   [https://evertiq.com/design/49328](https://evertiq.com/design/49328)

author: CharizardEmpire
body:
Seeking Advice: I have invested into a couple stocks/ETFs precovid, now which ones deserve more of my deposits moving forward?

Thank you in advanced to any folks that gives this a read. 

23, earning 70k yearly, saving for long term, open to risk, no debt

For some background info, I have invested 20K diversified into a mutual fund(VFIAX), 7 ETFs(VDE, VNQI, VGT, VB, CIBR, NOBL,USO) and 15 Stocks around March/April 2020 time period(AAPL, ETSY, MSFT,QRVO,QCOM,SWKS,SNE,TMUS,etc: Plan to sell NOK, ATVI and ERIC). I have not invested much since as I am trying to build my savings again however I aim to start investing $400 - $500 per month into my brokerage account starting 2021. Now my issue is how do I allocate that money into my stocks and funds? I have high priced stocks like Tesla(641) and Twilio(309). While also having lower priced stocks like Cloudflare(81) and Pagerduty(40). Now which stocks and ETFs deserve deposits of new money? The ones that are winning or the ones that are losing? Or should I plan to reinvest into 1 to 2 companies per month? So that by the time a year completes every stock/etf has had their fair share of deposits.

If any additional information is needed, please let me know! Thanks again

author: happierdayz4me2
body:
QC0M swing back to mid 150s. Prob missed boat on the insanely cheap jan and spring calls but weeklies are still cheap.

You can yolo skyworks Feb calls. They'll destroy earnings now that retail thinks they're going bankrupt over stale dreamy apple news. RF sales went from very strong in october to outstanding" in November. 

Feb 160 calls went from 10 to sub 3 last week. There were almost at 160 last week.

author: deviltrombone
body: Bought $SWKS yesterday. It was nearing the bottom of its channel, and then that Weiss guy pumped it on FMHTR, and it started reversing at that moment. He said he spoke to the company which told him 15-20% rev growth and 25-30% EPS growth next year. He rejected the idea they'll lose business to $QCOM due to them getting into the RF business, because Apple doesn't want to do more business with Qualcomm while developing their own modem to get away from them.

author: peter-doubt
body:
Cell *Towers* won't matter as much for 5G.. nearness and line of sight, as well as *numbers* will. But perhaps they have a product line to address that. 

5G..  for me, is SWKS.
